did.unittitle: Patrick Center for Environmental Research records

bioghist.p: Named in honor of Dr. Ruth Patrick, the Patrick Center for Environmental Research at the Academy of Natural Sciences consists of a multidisciplinary group of environmental scientists and engineers devoted to understanding aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems, including the effects of natural processes and human activities on environmental quality. The Center works with a number of diverse stakeholders, including government, community groups, industry and environmental organizations to improve environmental stewardship.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records from the Patrick Center for Environmental Research. Materials include: general files and surveys kept by Robert G. Grant, Jr. (1988-1999); project data sheets; correspondence and memos; reports; and project schedules and budgets. Projects include studies of environmental impacts of the Savannah River Plant, Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, Potomac Electric Power Company, and various DuPont facilities. The collection also includes files kept by Tran Noc Loi in the 1980s on Marine polychaetes (annelid worms), including data sheets and reprints and a CD containing the notebooks and papers of Danielle Kreeger.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Limnology Department records, Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Division of Environmental Research records, and Ruth Patrick papers.
